item.title: 2 years and 4 months later still not fixed, 18th January
item.description:
I looked back in my reports to see that this issue is now 2 years and 4 months "old" or since I reported it. Unacceptable.

item.title: Very large and deep pothole, 18th January
item.description:
There has been a large (1m diameter) pothole on the road bridge that goes over the A406 for over 2 months. It is on Colney Hatch Lane after Tesco on the road bridge. It is not near a house number but is in the direction of travel from Friern Barnet to Muswell Hill on the road bridge/flyover the A406.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colney Hatch Lane, Colney Hatch, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes, road surface worn away, 18th January
item.description:
The pothole has been on Netherlands road just past Temple Avenue on the way towards Oakleigh Park station for over a month. It is getting worse and has now turned into several potholes with the road surface worn away.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Netherlands Road, East Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken/sunken paving stones., 18th January
item.description:
The broken paving stones are a dangerous trip hazard and are located directly above services entering the house, this has the potential to create further problems. The problem has been reported before (8653842 on 9th January). A team turned up and made the situation safe with barriers, these completely block the pavement causing access issues to property and pedestrian’s on what is a busy road. The problem status is down as having been fixed following a progress enquiry made on 16th January. This is NOT the case. The barriers are still in place and no repairs have been carried out. We would appreciate your earliest attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Degema Road, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, fly tipping, dog waste on green space in front of 20 to 26 Wilson Grove, 18th January
item.description:
Sadly, this public open green space has got a red office chair dumped on it, several bags of dog poo, litter from takeaway food and drink cans. I would be most grateful if you could get a team down there give this public open space a really good clean. With many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wilson Grove, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
